parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Nominative Masculine 3rd Person Plural
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.

parse: Verb - Future Indicative Middle - 3rd Person Plural
str2: From apo and the base of olethros; to destroy fully, literally or figuratively.
A primary particle; but, and, etc.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Nominative 2nd Person Singular
str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 2nd Person Singular
str2: To remain, continue. From dia and meno; to stay constantly.

parse: Verb - Future Indicative Passive - 3rd Person Plural
str2: To make old, declare obsolete; pass: I grow old, become obsolete. From palaios; to make worn out, or declare obsolete.
Probably adverb of comparative from hos; which how, i.e. In that manner.
A long flowing outer garment, tunic. Neuter of a presumed derivative of ennumi; a dress.
